answers.answer: The skin pigmentation sounds like Acanthosis Nigricans (AN).  AN is a skin disorder that causes velvety, light brown to black markings that occur in areas including the neck, armpits, groin, and under the breasts.  Most people with AN have an insulin level that is higher than that of people of the same weight who do not have AN.Causes of acanthosis nigricans include:DiabetesObesityAddison's diseaseHypothyroidismPolycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS)Cushing's diseaseGrowth hormone therapyOral contraceptivesLarge doses of niacin (vitamin B3)CongenitalRarely associated with certain types of cancer, usually a gastric adenocarcinoma

question: My 10 year old daughter has recently developed darkness around her neck and armpits.  She is also complaining about transient pain in her left side. Can these symptoms be a manifestion of kidney or thyroid problems?
title: Hyperpigmentation and Painful Side.
